author: wistkey
title: 15 min Hello World Journey
description: Writing simple smart contracts to decide which chain to dev on, one needs hours on Cardano, but just mins on other chains. Put off dApp devs

f6_assessments.q0: The proposed solutions don’t quite address the problem. If the problem is the time it takes for a developer to write a smart contract on the Cardano block chain, then the solution should speak to that. Give some technical detail as it relates to how your proposed solution will address the challenges. Instead of saying ‘Filling in gaps defined in the exploration stage’ this is the point where you could give some details about those gaps.
f6_assessments.q1: I can’t with any certainty say this project will be implemented in its current state. I think if the proposer adheres to some of my suggestions there is a good chance my opinion would change. One more clearly marry the solution to the problem I stated in my impact statement.  Two fix the somewhat arbitrary breakdown of the budget e.g. gas-fees (how was that calculated), Founders fees. Lastly, consider asking for a smaller amount of the budget instead of the entire thing in the event of a budget shortfall.
f6_assessments.q2: The deliverables stated per each 3 months milestone seems to be reasonable and should allow stakeholders adequately assess the project’s progress.

f6_assessments.q0: I totally agree with your ideas. The proposal is suitable for the challenge of developing a programmer. A big problem right now is that there are very few talented developers in Haskell languages.
f6_assessments.q1: I agree with the roadmap outlined for the next 3-6 months. The job details are described in detail here. I have read carefully every detail you write and also understand that your group is an international group from many different countries. However, a specific profile of each team member in terms of work experience as well as identity will increase credibility as well as assessors can accurately assess your work performance!
f6_assessments.q2: It will be more specific if you add here a specific number to measure the work efficiency achieved. For example, add a measure of how many new wallet addresses are created on your Dapp. How many committed projects to cooperate with you?

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal aims to specifically address some key directions proposed in the challenge namely : 
- Developer productivity: IDE's, scripts to automate stuff.
- Knowledge base & Documentation
- Deployment, testing, and monitoring frameworks
- Samples, recipes and templates

It is aimed at easing barriers to entry and improving time to value for developers, which is key for the sustainability of the Cardano ecosystem
f6_assessments.q1:
The team from https://www.wistkey.com/ appears to be an experienced team and the timeline as well as budget seem reasonable.

Even if not a specific software development project, it would be useful to have an agile sprint based approach to iterate fast instead of having 3 months / 6 months milestones, since the core value proposition is to provide valuable content to developers. Iterating fast, integrating feedback cycles from a key developer community may also be an avenue for meeting the objectives
f6_assessments.q2:
For auditability to be achieved in a more transparent way, it would be useful to see a more detailed set of deliverables. For example : 
- how many specific project templates, on what key topics ( NFT style project, marketplace, ecommerce, identity, analytics, data exchange etc ), things that are quite often the case for Web 2.0 projects. This can help developers familiar from web 2.0 experience to transition to Web 3.0 development with blockchain/ Cardano
- what specific deliverables eg : videos, a specific channel, discord community channel etc , will be implemented to reach the forecast number of developers.
-

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer team obviously provides a thorough description of the proposed solution by going through the problems, motivation behind their project, and eventually their solution. They succeed in explaining how their project will bring their target audience (developers) positive influences and solve the problems they are facing. The solution also matches with some key metrics raised in the challenge setting (bridge the gap in the exploration stage, encourage more developers to join the Cardano community, increase developer productivity,...). The potential risks are well predicted with planned solving approaches. It would be a plus if they had a further explanation of the root cause of these main challenges
f6_assessments.q1: The timeline is well written with the main mission for each period of time and then split into smaller tasks showing more higher attainability. To make it easier to monitor the project, specific milestone times can be attached to every task in each phase. Based on the existing human resource and other conditions, they build a clear and optimized budget spending plan and provide a careful calculation for further double-check. The proposers have successfully presented their organizational structure, their missions, backgrounds, past experience, and clients range, indicating their ability to effectively implement this project
f6_assessments.q2: This team really knows what they are doing by providing clear and achievable goals based on their detailed roadmap for each milestone. The indicators for measuring success are also easy to grasp (for example, the number of users). They also mention the ideal time developers have to spend using their service (1 hour, ultimately 15 mins), which shows an explicit description of how this project can help them.

f6_assessments.q0: The team clearly  outlines the problems that issuers on the Cardano exchange face and what they will do to help developers solve the problems and get closer to the platform. And, the proposer does not give particular feature or any information about the solution, let provide more information in this part. In addition, the proposer has also clearly stated the risks that the project may face and proposed a solution more clealy. This shows that the founder really learns and has a great desire to develop
f6_assessments.q1: The tasks are clearly divided by time so that it is easy for everyone to keep track of what is done during this time period. This is a pretty clever plan. In addition, the spending plan is also quite realistic when referring to prices from the labor market, thus giving voters a more objective view of spending. However, for the team members section. I understand members come from all over the world so it's hard for you to aggregate information about each person, but what do you think about adding information of core members like the founders to the platform foundation.
f6_assessments.q2: This plan has very clear goals and it has been detailed through the numbers in this section. Looking at this, you can clearly understand what the proposer is aiming for in the future. This is a very good point, when you see the goal clearly, you will understand what you need to do to achieve it. Howver, team should provide the tool for voters to check.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal explained why developers are still afraid to join Cardano due to entry barriers such as running the nodes and building up infrastructures by themselves. Therefore, this proposal suggested building a tool employing APIs and ready nodes for development that helps make it easier for developers to get used to the Cardano ecosystem and start building apps there in just a short period of time, approximately from 1-2 working hours. Having said that, the proposer did not mention in detail the product offered with specific functions and features in technical aspects. The outcome was not clearly demonstrated, so it is difficult to see how this tool really facilitates developers to build apps. Some challenges and how to overcome them were listed, yet not in great detail. It listed the challenge-related entry barrier for learning Cardano, which is not appropriate. Because this is the problem that this project needs to figure out ways to solve. The challenge should relate to some difficulty or potential risk that it may face when executing the solution to reduce entry barriers.
f6_assessments.q1: In general, this proposal gave out a plan with a timeline in different months. Nevertheless, more technical information in each phase should be mentioned in the plan to make it clearer. One point that is highly evaluated is that it included a full team that is needed to operate this project and then distribute the cost based on that. However, the proposed plan will last 9 months, the budget breakdown was just for 6 months.Therefore, the proposal should mention why this project just needs sponsoring for 6 months only. Though the proposer tried to prove the feasibility of this project by mentioning that they launched some products and services to develop blockchain, the operating team consists of innovative individuals from different nations in the world, their clients from Widi (www.thewidi.com) to prominent NGOs like Unicef, and big corporations like SKY Group in the UK., it would be more persuasive to enclose their products' reference link or describe more about their previous work results and what experience from the past project to benefit this one
f6_assessments.q2: A highlight here is clear KPIs with specific numbers to audit the process of the project that were well-written in accordance with the plan. Besides, the expected result was also stated in great detail including the amount of time, 1 hour and 15mins, that one new developer needs to spend to write a small contract in Cardano. This complied with the targeted outcome mentioned in the plan at the beginning. Therefore, it is possible to audit this project

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is very well written. The idea that you have is very ambitious but yet very realistic since it comes from your own experience on Cardano and your desire to make it become a friendly ecosystem. I understand that even with the most experienced developers, it still takes quite sometimes to get to know a new ecosystem and it’s easy to get lost in transition without an effective guides.  If this project can be launched, with the help of the beginning short and simple instructions, I believe that every developer will feel very welcome when they first come to Cardano. The team not only addresses the challenge very well but also knows what they are aiming for. The foreseeable risks have been taken to considerations and the team has the fundamental ideas of the solutions, that’s huge plus point.
f6_assessments.q1: Firstly, i want to thank you for a very detailed introduction of the team. That definitely helps people get to know you and your vision better. For the feasibility, the team has built a fairly detailed timeline with a budget breakdown. Since the to-do list and its timeline is closely stick with your idea, I rate it highly. However, I would suggest to add more estimated time for each bullet point of your plan, and also after that 6 month plan, do you have some further ideas and preparation for maintaining the project in a long run? The idea of getting volunteers is not a bad idea since I think I will give opportunities for freelance and new developers and I believe that you can find some suitable platforms to seek for them.
f6_assessments.q2: The team has provided an excellent descriptions of the sections that are relevant to assessing the auditability of the project. It has provided the necessary information to understand the immediate actions following the allocation of funds. In my opinion, this section is consistent with what the team is aiming for. The key metric of each objective is established and it’s very critical for the community to audit anytime during the progression. Hence, I believe that this project will be a success.

f6_assessments.q0: From my point of views, your idea proposal was pretty fascinating, straightforward, and beneficial to read. Thank you for providing this information. Also congratulations on the progress so far. To begin with, the proposal was developed with the goal of demonstrating to developers how to write a simple smart contract in 15 minutes utilizing the proposer's API keys rather than their own nodes.One of the commendable points of the proposal in the impact section is that it offers features and targeted audiences, such as giving app developers a great set of tools that integrate everything they require. Nevertheless, I think you should be more specific about the benefits, risks, and workarounds related to  your platform. For instance, who will encounter barriers to entry? Or what will the documentation and video tutorials on overcoming those obstacles include?  One thing to note is that, although this proposal matches with the challenge in some way, I believe that it has not had much effect on key metrics. There is no mention of the amount of developers actively building on top of Cardano or the number of repos on Github that use the tooling, for example.
f6_assessments.q1: In terms of feasibility, in my opinion, the timeline and milestones for the proposal are clearly outlined, and the proposed timeframe is acceptable. For example, in three months, they will create a toolkit for application developers to study and test their code on the testnet. The next six months will be spent improving the template projects and integrating various Cardano nodes into the ecosystem. However, the proposal fails to present not only a description of the team's abilities and experience, but also a reference to back up those claims. One of praiseworthy points of this section is that it clearly states the number of employees involved in the project as well as how to allocate tasks to each person. Besides that, a good point for this proposal is that the proposer has detailed salary details for each job position, Cardano Gas-fees budgets and cloud hosting. In spite of that, your team did not still unidentify the incurred costs and estimated budget. Although the group includes active members from many countries around the world, they have a close connection, coordination and always support each other to accomplish well not only in the community but also in the community. carry out other initiatives and projects. They demonstrate the perfect blend of skills and knowledge to form a diverse and well-prepared team ready to take on challenges. Besides, efforts to create web mamahelper (www.mamahelpers.io) - the world's largest network of foreign employees, will create connectivity between many countries, increase job opportunities as well as create create a large community with more than 200,000+ members for everyone to support each other. In addition, the website will also support international events such as OFWs Got Talent, OFW MasterChef, and the OFW Academy.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal offers a realistic schedule for the delivery of the project and a definition of success is clear and transparent: Within 3 months, there are 50 developers using and 10 projects using the service. And after 6 months, the platform have 150 developers using and 30 projects using the service. The indicated KPI tracks the progress of the project it's really good and can provide easily to the community the ability to audit the goals. I appreciate the team's sense of responsibility and serious working attitude. such as orienting and articulating the future of the community in alignment with the original targets.

f6_assessments.q0: this is a project to build a tool that allows developers to write a simple smart contract using vendor API keys in 15 minutes. The proposer expects that through this project, developers can shorten the learning curve, reduce barriers to entry into the Cardano ecosystem, and facilitate the dApp development process. The goals set by the project are consistent with the Challenge's KPIs. The proposer also highlights the core functionalities of the platform they want to develop. However, the author seems to be drifting into storytelling without specifically describing the specifications of the platform, the details about the product are few. They have described very well the possible risks and how to minimize them. I appreciate the relevance of the suggestion and the Key metrics of the Challenge, so I'm giving this 4 stars, I hope with the Please describe your proposed solution they will be able to summarize it neatly and succinctly and easy to understand instead of getting caught up in storytelling like that.
f6_assessments.q1: It seems that this is a stub project, they don't have a ready staff yet, still in the proposal and recruiting stage, I hope to see a more detailed recruitment plan. No details are available on the proposer - the founder of this project, it is difficult for readers to verify the skills and work experience of the proposer in this field, they will not be confident enough idea to invest in a project where the identity and qualifications of the project owner have not been verified. I hope the author will solve this problem soon so that the credibility of the project is increased. The plus point is that they have presented a very good plan to develop the platform in two timelines of 3 months and 6 months, each timeline briefly and easy to understand what activities will take place and the goals to be achieved. They also have a clear plan for releasing prototypes, getting feedback and improvements before the final product is released, I'd appreciate that, but I haven't seen them set a timeline to launch the Official platform. The budget is also described in detail in terms of personnel positions, time, and the number of employees, but the reader will find it difficult to understand the cost of paying for the 3 founders when they do not know the people who are the founders. Who are these people, what do they contribute to the project? I see they will cooperate with a partner company in Web development, but if there is a problem during the cooperation, what is the contingency plan? Who will be the replacement partner? I wish they would think more about this. With this part, I will give 3 stars because there is still too much information missing, especially about personnel.
f6_assessments.q2: They have built a plan to report project progress at least once a week. Weekly Commit at least once after kick starting and Bi-Weekly Release at least once after Week 3. However, tools are not provided/ a way for those interested in the project to track the progress of the project. The roadmap is detailed with milestones and goals to be achieved. The team also identified the expected number of users at each stage. They list quite a few goals they expect to achieve in the future, but they build short-term plans for 3 months and 6 months, I would like to see a longer-term plan for the community to follow the development direction of the project and the goals they achieve. In my opinion, because the project's personnel is not stable, it is easy to take risks in building a team of personnel and partners, I hope they will think and come up with a plan to deal with risks. risks and costs incurred to handle these risks. For this part, I will give it 3 stars.

f6_assessments.q0: The basic idea behind the proposal is quite good, they adopt the “get a taste first” approach to lower the entry barrier for application developers and encourage them to use Cardano. The proposal is well-structured and planned, with such a clear objective and consultation government and has a potential to add great value to the Carnado ecosystem which aligns with the problem statement. This challenge helps Cardano's goal of hastening the growth and expansion of the developer and app ecosystem. However, some key metrics are still unmet. For example, I haven’t seen how this challenge will affect the number of repos on Github using the tooling (month over month increase). I would only ask if I can see some specific number in the key metrics section although I know it may be very difficult to do so. Although it is still early days, it could have been good to add some estimations such as how many devs the app will have one each stage.
f6_assessments.q1: The team has extensive experience, and the proposal has sufficient material to prove it. For some years, the team has also been working in a variety of disciplines and the catalytic ecosystem. The budget is clearly specified and broken down into identifiable items, and it is reasonable in order to meet the established goals. I estimate that the cost is reasonable to achieve the set goal , but that more funding will be required. The proposal includes a reasonable timetable for completing the work. The proposer may have had certain obstacles and risks related to effective implementation; nonetheless, for the time being, the main risk indicated is that they require financing to function, which is understandable. It will be fascinating to learn about the longer-term plans for maintaining and improving such a platform.
f6_assessments.q2: They did an excellent job of outlining the many phases, ranging from the short term (3 months - 6 months) to the long term (many years later), each with a brief overview of what would take place. The team went a step further by informing the community about what will happen in the near future. Furthermore, the team specifies in detail what performance measures they anticipate to have, which I believe are important, particularly for the first six months because these will have a concrete impact. The platform's open-source nature also contributes to its audibility. This will help the community to fully grasp how the project is developing and where it is heading.

f6_assessments.q0:
Blockchain technology is considered a fast growing science field. 
Every day more and more developers and companies are moving towards blockchain-based applications. 
Cryptocurencies provide a protected and secured environment for people to work, communicate, vote and make transactions.
As a result, more and more developers will be needed to support this edifice. These developers have to be well trained in 
blockchain technology and smart contracts as well. Smart contracts are considered a significant tool, that ensures the safety
of the transactions and makes the system trustworthy. As a consequence a well made guide that introduces the developers to
write simple smart contracts may be the solution we need for the smart contracts be widely used by individuals and companies.
Cardano has all the prospects needed to be broadly used so such a 15 min guide should be considered a must.
f6_assessments.q1:
The project's plan seems well structured. Furthermore there is clear schedule of how the project will be implemented and evaluated
during the process. These two componets make me feel safe about the success of this attempt. There is an organized timetable in
which the important points are clear mentioned. In addition, the team that implements this project seems experienced in projects
like this and they have former experience in smart contracts based in other familiar cryptocurencies. I love the idea that 
developers are meant to evaluate the project every now and then in order to provide the best feedback possible. Also the team
seems skilled and the have a wide clients group. Equally, we know that many people have already trusted them and the team did not 
fail them. Last but not least, the fact that they explained their project plan in so simple words that even a non expert was able 
to understand it, made me feel that they have an in-depth knowledge of what they are trying to do.
f6_assessments.q2:
Although I firmly believe that there is high possibility of the project to be succesful, I feel there's some points that need to
be improved. For example there is no explanation about how the developers using the API will be selected. Furthermore it is not
clear how the developpers working on the project will be evaluated. I am also questioning about what the evaluation process will
be. These are my only concerns. After this point, I have faith that the team is capable of make this project succesfull. The
information provided is sufficient to make be trust the project and the team.

f6_assessments.q0: Smart contracts is a significant part of blockchain technology and decentralized finance. More and more people and companies tend to want to learn and use blockchain technology and services for their needs. I strongly believe that tutorials are necessary to help them learn easier and faster. I am a developer who have worked using open source Cardano tools such as cardano-node and cardano-db-sync, and when I started exploring Cardano I found it difficult to find great tuorials to learn. As smart contracts is more difficult to be understood by people who have not worked before with them and want to learn in order to be productive, I firmly believe that a 15 minutes tutorial will be really important as an introduction for new developers. Furthermore, in the future, the project infrastructure could be utilized and expanded to support other tutorial for more experienced developers. Thus, I believe the team should be given the opportunity to work on such an interesting and significant project.
f6_assessments.q1: The team behind this project proposal gives me the impression that will make the project come true. They have a lot of clients with who they cooperate, so I believe that when they have a goal to achieve, they try to give their best. This is the reason why the have worked with so many well known clients. Furthermore, the plan is well-detailed and written in a professional way. It is written is such a simple way that any reader can understand the objective of the project proposal. There are some information missing as I state in the next assessment note, but in general they have given all the necessary information for the proposal readers to understand the importance of the project for new developers who want to learn more about Cardano smart contracts. I also believe that when someone can express in simple words their ideas and how they will achieve their goal, they show that they have understood in depth how they will achieve it. Finally, the team has experience working on similar projects which truly shows that they will succeed if they are given the chance.
f6_assessments.q2: I believe that the plan is well-explained and it is easy for every reader to understand the goal of the proposal and how it will be achieved. The only point I would like to mention is that I would like to see a more detailed plan of how each of the team members will work. For example, I would like to know why this project requires 11 persons to work. What if there is a need of another web2 developer? Will the project be completed if more people are needed to work on the project? What happens if there is such a need? What is the plan of the team if the project finds half-way that the project is not proposal and how it will be achieved. The only point I would like to mention is that I would like to see a more detailed plan of how each of the team members will work. For example, I would like to know why this project requires 11 persons to work. What if there is a need of another web2 developer? Will the project be completed if more people are needed to work on the project? What happens if there is such a need? What is the plan of the team if the project finds half-way that the project cannot completed on time? I just mention that maybe the team should add some information about some defensive mechanisms and what will happen if something goes wrong. In conclusion, I believe that the project proposal is detailed and it will succeed, but I would like to also know how the team will try to overcome some of the difficulties that may arise in the process. From this, I would also understand how the team works in difficult situations. completed on time? I just mention that maybe the team should add some information about some defensive mechanisms and what will happen if something goes wrong. In conclusion, I believe that the project proposal is detailed and it will succeed

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal develops tools which enable developers to enjoy fast API integration with the least learning effort. Through a 15 min guide, devs could have a taste of writing a simple smart contract using API keys, without having to run their own nodes.
This lowers the barrier to entry for developers, saving them time and effort. It makes the number of developers access Cardano more and more, bringing the Cardano ecosystem to flourish.
f6_assessments.q1:
Based on the information you have provided. You have a very strong team. Including many members from many different countries, they have full knowledge, skills and experience to implement the project. In addition, they belong to the same company (Wistkey International Group), this is a great advantage, because they already have a good relationship with each other. In particular, they have achieved many successes together: growing and improving MamaHelper - the world's largest overseas foreign worker network,... With the above reasons, I am sure your team is fully capable of implementing the project.
You have identified the to-dos and detailed 6-month roadmap. Measures to reduce risks and challenges that will be encountered during project implementation are also described in detail. Success metrics have been provided, making the assessment a lot easier.
Budget allocation is quite clear, transparent, great when you are trying to find ways to cut costs (seeking expert advice on a voluntary basis, finding volunteers to join the team, ...). However, you mentioned "Cardano Gas-fees Budget: $2,500.00", is this really accurate?
f6_assessments.q2: The information is provided fully and transparently, from which we can predict the success of the project. I realize this project has a lot of potential, it can be done successfully. Breaking this entry barrier will help attract more developers to Cardano. I see the enthusiasm and efforts of the whole team in this project, hope it will be funded at fund8. Thanks for a great suggestion!

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal is about providing an environment for developrs to thrive in the ecosystem by making it easy to build dApps etc on Cardano. Providing  a great user experience is at the core of this challenge. Setting up tools and infrastructures for developers to work with ease and faster thereby Saving time and cost to engage in other productive activities is a welcomed proposal. This proposal has the potential to encourage and onboard more developers from outside community into the ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal did not provide a detailed profile of its team members instead, a brief explanation of the entity was stated. In addition, there is no evidence/links or ways of verifying their experience and/or past achievements in the space. Also, the budget estimates were poorly presented and presented as the figures/estimates did not add up with the Founders' renumeration and what are the merits for enumerating the founders in the estimates. However, a well detailed Milestones for implementation was provided. There was no provision for the marketing and promotion of the project. It will be great to know how the project would be marketed to attract new developers with this infrastructures in place.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a well detailed set of basis to assess the success of the project coupled with the detailed milestones.

solution: Through a 15min guide, devs could have a taste of writing a simple smart contract using our API keys, without having to run their own nodes.
experience: We suffer this painpoint ourselves. We are dApp devs that were being put off by Cardano dev environment before. We love Cardano’s vision and its focus on Decentralisation and Security. However, the initial experience and learning curve of trying out Cardano really put us off.
